questions_vertical: 0. An outer garment for covering the body from the waist to the ankles, divided into sections to fit each leg separately.
1. An item of clothing worn on the feet.
questions_horizontal: 0. The T shape made with the body and sleeves.
1. Sweater or hoodie, a piece of clothing pulled over the head instead of buttoned or zipped-up.
3. A durable covering for the human foot, made of leather or similar material with a rigid sole and heel, usually extending no higher than the ankle.

questions_vertical: 0. Any similar small animal of various rodent and marsupial families.
1.  A cat, Acinonyx jubatus, of southwestern Asia and Africa, resembling a leopard but having certain doglike characteristics.
2. The wormlike larva of a butterfly or a moth.
questions_horizontal: 0. A small domesticated carnivore, Felis domestica or F. catus, bred in a number of varieties.
1.  Social insects of the family Formicidae, of worldwide distribution especially in warm climates
2. Any of several short-tailed, stout-bodied, burrowing rodents, as Cricetus cricetus, of Europe and Asia, having large cheek pouches.
3. A large, usually tawny-yellow cat, Panthera leo, native to Africa and southern Asia, having a tufted tail and, in the male, a large mane.
